statement:
Let $f$ be a piecewise real-valued function defined on some interval
$[a,b]$, such that $f$ has only a finite number of discontinuities and
extrema in $[a,b]$. Then the Fourier series of this function converges
to $f$ when $f$ is continuous and to the arithmetic mean of the
left-handed and right-handed of $f$ at a point where it is
discontinuous.
